byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Eric Schmitt from Colorado Springs. Amy Chozick contributed reporting from Philadelphia.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: American intelligence agencies say they have 'high confidence' that Russian government orchestrated theft of emails and documents from Democratic National Committee, but are uncertain whether theft was routine cyberespionage or attempt to sway results of 2016 election; revelation presents Obama administration with difficult decision over whether to publicly accuse Russia of engineering hacking.
lead_paragraph: American intelligence agencies cautioned that they are uncertain whether the breach was an effort to manipulate the 2016 presidential election.

headline.main: Spy Agency Consensus Grows That Russia Hacked D.N.C.
headline.print_headline: Spy Agency Consensus Grows That Russia Hacked D.N.C.

snippet: American intelligence agencies cautioned that they are uncertain whether the breach was an effort to manipulate the 2016 presidential election....
